intro: Balsamocarpon brevifolium, commonly known as the short-leaved balsamocarpon, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface and its umbellate inflorescence, typical of the carrot family. The plant produces small white to pale yellow flowers that attract various pollinators such as bees and flies. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
